thread.title: Bethlehem Catholic's Mike Labriola commits to Nebraska for wrestling
thread.title_full: Bethlehem Catholic's Mike Labriola commits to Nebraska for wrestling

title: Bethlehem Catholic's Mike Labriola commits to Nebraska for wrestling
text:
Bethlehem Catholic junior Mikey Labriola (right) has committed to wrestle at Nebraska. (Chris Post | lehighvalleylive.com contributor) By Brad Wilson | For lehighvalleylive.com on October 23, 2015 5:29 PM View/Post Comments 
Bethlehem Catholic junior Mikey Labriola announced his verbal commitment to wrestle at the University of Nebraska via Twitter Friday afternoon. 
" Happy to announce that I have verbally committed to further my academic and wrestling career at Nebraska," read Labriola's tweet. 
Labriola's senior teammate, two-time PIAA champion Luke Karam , had recently chosen Lehigh over Nebraska as his destination. 
Labriola's career record is 80-16. He was third at 152 pounds in the PIAA Class AAA tournament as a sophomore to cap a 46-6 season and is a two-time state medalist. Last year he was District 11 Class AAA champion and he won the Escape the Rock and Tony Iasiello Christmas City Tournaments.
